Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Tigerinin 3 (Tigerinin-3; XXA, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; XXU; 1S=S, frog, amphibians, animals; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Both the disulfide bond and C-terminal amidation are essential for peptide activity

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  It contains one disulfide bond.Activity: Active against B. subtilis (MIC 30 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 8530 (MIC 30 ug/ml), E. coli W 160.37 (MIC 40 ug/ml), P. putida NCIM 2102 (MIC 40 ug/ml), M. luteus MT 166 (MIC 30 ug/ml), and yeast S. cerevisiae ATCC 8530 (MIC 80 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria: permeated bacterial membranes.In vitro toxicity:  rat RBC (erythrocytes): The peptide is not hemo.lytic up to a concentration of 200 ug/ml.Updated 5/2020; 7/2021; Jan2025
Literature Information.Author: Sai KP, Jagannadham MV, Vairamani M, Raju NP, Devi AS, Nagaraj R, Sitaram N.2001
Literature Information.Title: Tigerinins: novel antimicrobial peptides from the Indian frog Rana tigerina.
